author: Reuters Editorial
title: India's 2017 tea exports jump 8.2 pct to 241 mln kg-Board
text:
MUMBAI, Feb 8 (Reuters) - India’s tea exports in 2017 jumped 8.2 percent from a year ago to 240.68 million kg due to good demand from Egypt, Iran and China, the state-run Tea Board said in a statement.
India, the world’s second-biggest tea producer, exports CTC (crush-tear-curl) grade mainly to Egypt, Pakistan and the UK, and the orthodox variety to Iraq, Iran and Russia.
The country’s production edged up just a percent in 2017 to 1278.9 million kg, the Board said in a separate statement. (Reporting by Rajendra Jadhav; Editing by Amrutha Gayathri)
